thread.title: Van Pelt, Runnels earn HOF honors
thread.title_full: Van Pelt, Runnels earn HOF honors

title: Van Pelt, Runnels earn HOF honors
text:
Van Pelt, Runnels earn HOF honors Staff report 5:04 p.m. EDT October 7, 2015 Buy Photo 5 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Richmond natives Bo Van Pelt and Skip Runnels will enter the Indiana Golf Hall of Fame on Nov. 19 in a ceremony at Forest Hills Country Club. 
Van Pelt grew up playing on the Indiana Junior Golf Tour and won numerous individual titles. He went on to play at Richmond High School, where he was named all-state in 1993. He then attended Oklahoma State University and was named an All-American in 1997 and 1998. 
Van Pelt earned his PGA Tour card in 1998 and has maintained his status for the last 17 years. While on the tour, he has participated in 356 events, made 228 cuts, had 125 top-25 finishes, 50 top-10 finishes and competed 
Van Pelt is also the founder and ongoing ambassador of The First Tee Indiana-Richmond Chapter. Buy Photo 
Skip Runnels (Photo: Palladium-Item Joshua Smith) 
Runnels played on the Richmond High School Golf Team from 1969-71 and was a three-year letter winner. He went on the play at Ball State University where he won the 1975 Ball State Invitational. 
Runnels has won 15 club championships, 30 team championships — including a win at the 1995 USGA Team Championship — and three IGA individual Championships. Runnels was also named the IGA Senior Player of the Year in 2013. He has won a record 18 Men's City Amateur championships. Read or Share this story: http://pinews.co/1Rugeek TOP VIDEOS
